TopicTitle: Bug on startup with KSRSS installed

Articles.Content: Hi, I just installed KSRSS and all the dependencies and stuff, and I used Sigma Dimensions for 2.5x rescale, but there was a bug on startup! I can't upload the KSP.log and Logs/Kopernicus file, and I couldn't find the ModuleManager.ConfigCache file in my KSP directory.

1. Find a reputable file sharing site, such as Dropbox, and make an account;
  2. Upload KSP.log from the root KSP folder and the ModuleManager files inside KSP/GameData, as well as the Kopernicus logs and if possible Player.log too (see link below);
  3. Post link(s) here.

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/

The vast majority of times this is a problem with placing the planet pack in the wrong place.  It should be [KSP Folder]/GameData/KSRSS.  Sometimes it ends up in [KSP Folder]/GameData/GameData/KSRSS or has an altered name (e.g. KSRSS Copy).

If it's not something as simple as that you may want to head to the KSRSS page:

 Following jimmymcgoochie's advice above, they may be able to help.

Edited January 3, 2022 by Pehvbot

Edit: I've decided I'll just use google drive
